q: "We just were so excited, so we were telling her how proud we were of her and how she was inspiring the whole nation with her courage and with her strength," Ms. Kirsten Gillibrand later said. And then Debbie Wasserman Schultz and I started joking about all the things we were going to do after she got better. And we were holding her hand, and she was responding to our hand-holding. Reflecting on the Arizona shootings that killed six people and badly wounded Rep. Gabrielle Giffords , Colin Powell said he was dismayed by the harsh tenor of political debate that some have said may have contributed to the attack. There has crept in our society and our public dialogue, a coarseness, a nastiness, an attack of people who don't share the same views as you do, he said. "All sorts of nastiness.
